title._content: U.S. National Museum and Mall After Snow Storm

description._content: Author: Unknown Subject: National Museum of Natural History (U.S.)        United States National Museum        Natural History Building Type: Photographic print     Landscape Date: 1911 Topic: Washington Monument (Washington, D.C.)      Museum visitors      Snow      Natural History Building--South Entrance Standard number: 26870-A Physical description: Color: Black and White; Size: 6 1/4w x 8h; Type of Image: Landscape; Medium: Photographic print Notes: See Neg. # 26870-B for photo of same snow storm Summary: The Mall, looking towards the Washington Monument, and the south entrance of the United States National Museum, now known as the National Museum of Natural History, after a snow storm. Two men are standing in the snow in front of the museum Place: Mall, The (Washington, D.C.) Persistent URL:Link to data base record Repository:Smithsonian Archives - History Div View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
